00015 /*!\fn static inline uint32_t rotl32 ( uint32_t x, int8_t r )
00016  *\brief rotate byte 32bit version (from murmur's author)
00017  *\param x value
00018  *\param r rotation value
00019  *\return rotated value
00020  */ 
00021 static uint32_t rotl32 ( uint32_t x, int8_t r )
00022 {
00023                 return (x << r) | (x >> (32 - r));
00024 } /* rotl32(...) */
00025 
00026 #endif
00027 
00028 /*!\fn FORCE_INLINE uint32_t getblock( const uint32_t *p , int i )
00029  *\brief Block read - (from murmur's author) 
00030  if your platform needs to do endian-swapping or can only
00031  handle aligned reads, do the conversion here
00032  *\param p value
00033  *\param i position
00034  *\return value at position inside block
00035  */
00036 FORCE_INLINE uint32_t getblock( const uint32_t *p , int i )
00037 {
00038                 uint32_t var ;
00039                 memcpy( &var , p+i , sizeof( uint32_t ) );
00040 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00041                 var = htonl( var );
00042 #endif
00043                 return var ;
00044 } /* get_block(...) */
00045 
00046 
00047 
00048 /*!\fn FORCE_INLINE uint32_t fmix32 ( uint32_t h )
00049  *\brief Finalization mix - force all bits of a hash block to avalanche (from murmur's author) 
00050  *\param h value
00051  *\return mixed value
00052  */
00053 FORCE_INLINE uint32_t fmix32 ( uint32_t h )
00054 {
00055                 h ^= h >> 16;
00056                 h *= 0x85ebca6b;
00057                 h ^= h >> 13;
00058                 h *= 0xc2b2ae35;
00059                 h ^= h >> 16;
00060 
00061                 return h;
00062 } /* fmix32(...) */
00063 
00064 /*!\fn FORCE_INLINE uint64_t fmix64 ( uint64_t k )
00065  *\brief Finalization mix - force all bits of a hash block to avalanche, 64bit version (from murmur's author) 
00066  *\param k value
00067  *\return mixed value
00068  */
00069 FORCE_INLINE uint64_t fmix64 ( uint64_t k )
00070 {
00071                 k ^= k >> 33;
00072                 k *= BIG_CONSTANT(0xff51afd7ed558ccd);
00073                 k ^= k >> 33;
00074                 k *= BIG_CONSTANT(0xc4ceb9fe1a85ec53);
00075                 k ^= k >> 33;
00076 
00077                 return k;
00078 } /* fmix64(...) */
00079

00082 /*!\fn void MurmurHash3_x86_32 ( const void * key, int len, uint32_t seed, void * out )
00083  * brief MurmurHash3 was written by Austin Appleby, and is placed in the public
00084  domain. The author hereby disclaims copyright to this source code.
00085  Note - The x86 and x64 versions do _not_ produce the same results, as the
00086  algorithms are optimized for their respective platforms. You can still
00087  compile and run any of them on any platform, but your performance with the
00088  non-native version will be less than optimal. 
00089  *\param key char *string as the key
00090  *\param len size of the key
00091  *\param seed seed value for murmur hash
00092  *\param out generated hash  
00093  */
00094 void MurmurHash3_x86_32 ( const void * key, int len, uint32_t seed, void * out )
00095 {
00096                 const uint8_t * data = (const uint8_t*)key;
00097                 const int nblocks = len / 4;
00098 
00099                 uint32_t h1 = seed;
00100 
00101                 uint32_t c1 = 0xcc9e2d51;
00102                 uint32_t c2 = 0x1b873593;
00103 
00104                 /* body */
00105                 const uint32_t * blocks = (const uint32_t *)(data + nblocks*4);
00106 
00107                 for(int i = -nblocks; i; i++)
00108                 {
00109                                 uint32_t k1 = getblock(blocks,i);
00110 
00111                                 k1 *= c1;
00112                                 k1 = ROTL32(k1,15);
00113                                 k1 *= c2;
00114 
00115                                 h1 ^= k1;
00116                                 h1 = ROTL32(h1,13); 
00117                                 h1 = h1*5+0xe6546b64;
00118                 }
00119 
00120                 /* tail */
00121                 const uint8_t * tail = (const uint8_t*)(data + nblocks*4);
00122 
00123                 uint32_t k1 = 0;
00124 
00125                 switch(len & 3)
00126                 {
00127                                 case 3: k1 ^= tail[2] << 16;
00128                                 case 2: k1 ^= tail[1] << 8;
00129                                 case 1: k1 ^= tail[0];
00130                                                                 k1 *= c1; k1 = ROTL32(k1,15); k1 *= c2; h1 ^= k1;
00131                                 default:
00132                                                                 break ;
00133                 };
00134 
00135                 /* finalization */
00136                 h1 ^= len;
00137                 h1 = fmix32(h1);
00138                 *(uint32_t*)out = h1;
00139 } /* MurmurHash3_x86_32(...) */ 
00140 
00141 
00142 
00143 /*!\fn void MurmurHash3_x86_128( const void * key, int len, uint32_t seed, void * out )
00144  * brief MurmurHash3 was written by Austin Appleby, and is placed in the public
00145  domain. The author hereby disclaims copyright to this source code.
00146  Note - The x86 and x64 versions do _not_ produce the same results, as the
00147  algorithms are optimized for their respective platforms. You can still
00148  compile and run any of them on any platform, but your performance with the
00149  non-native version will be less than optimal. 
00150  *\param key char *string as the key
00151  *\param len size of the key
00152  *\param seed seed value for murmur hash
00153  *\param out generated hash  
00154  */
00155 void MurmurHash3_x86_128 ( const void * key, const int len, uint32_t seed, void * out )
00156 {
00157                 const uint8_t * data = (const uint8_t*)key;
00158                 const int nblocks = len / 16;
00159 
00160                 uint32_t h1 = seed;
00161                 uint32_t h2 = seed;
00162                 uint32_t h3 = seed;
00163                 uint32_t h4 = seed;
00164 
00165                 uint32_t c1 = 0x239b961b; 
00166                 uint32_t c2 = 0xab0e9789;
00167                 uint32_t c3 = 0x38b34ae5; 
00168                 uint32_t c4 = 0xa1e38b93;
00169 
00170                 /* body */
00171                 const uint32_t * blocks = (const uint32_t *)(data + nblocks*16);
00172 
00173                 for(int i = -nblocks; i; i++)
00174                 {
00175                                 uint32_t k1 = getblock(blocks,i*4+0);
00176                                 uint32_t k2 = getblock(blocks,i*4+1);
00177                                 uint32_t k3 = getblock(blocks,i*4+2);
00178                                 uint32_t k4 = getblock(blocks,i*4+3);
00179 
00180                                 k1 *= c1; k1  = ROTL32(k1,15); k1 *= c2; h1 ^= k1;
00181                                 h1 = ROTL32(h1,19); h1 += h2; h1 = h1*5+0x561ccd1b;
00182 
00183                                 k2 *= c2; k2  = ROTL32(k2,16); k2 *= c3; h2 ^= k2;
00184                                 h2 = ROTL32(h2,17); h2 += h3; h2 = h2*5+0x0bcaa747;
00185 
00186                                 k3 *= c3; k3  = ROTL32(k3,17); k3 *= c4; h3 ^= k3;
00187                                 h3 = ROTL32(h3,15); h3 += h4; h3 = h3*5+0x96cd1c35;
00188 
00189                                 k4 *= c4; k4  = ROTL32(k4,18); k4 *= c1; h4 ^= k4;
00190                                 h4 = ROTL32(h4,13); h4 += h1; h4 = h4*5+0x32ac3b17;
00191                 }
00192 
00193                 /* tail */
00194                 const uint8_t * tail = (const uint8_t*)(data + nblocks*16);
00195 
00196                 uint32_t k1 = 0;
00197                 uint32_t k2 = 0;
00198                 uint32_t k3 = 0;
00199                 uint32_t k4 = 0;
00200 
00201                 switch(len & 15)
00202                 {
00203                                 case 15: k4 ^= tail[14] << 16;
00204                                 case 14: k4 ^= tail[13] << 8;
00205                                 case 13: k4 ^= tail[12] << 0;
00206                                                                  k4 *= c4; k4  = ROTL32(k4,18); k4 *= c1; h4 ^= k4;
00207 
00208                                 case 12: k3 ^= tail[11] << 24;
00209                                 case 11: k3 ^= tail[10] << 16;
00210                                 case 10: k3 ^= tail[ 9] << 8;
00211                                 case  9: k3 ^= tail[ 8] << 0;
00212                                                                  k3 *= c3; k3  = ROTL32(k3,17); k3 *= c4; h3 ^= k3;
00213 
00214                                 case  8: k2 ^= tail[ 7] << 24;
00215                                 case  7: k2 ^= tail[ 6] << 16;
00216                                 case  6: k2 ^= tail[ 5] << 8;
00217                                 case  5: k2 ^= tail[ 4] << 0;
00218                                                                  k2 *= c2; k2  = ROTL32(k2,16); k2 *= c3; h2 ^= k2;
00219 
00220                                 case  4: k1 ^= tail[ 3] << 24;
00221                                 case  3: k1 ^= tail[ 2] << 16;
00222                                 case  2: k1 ^= tail[ 1] << 8;
00223                                 case  1: k1 ^= tail[ 0] << 0;
00224                                                                  k1 *= c1; k1  = ROTL32(k1,15); k1 *= c2; h1 ^= k1;
00225                                 default:
00226                                                                  break ;
00227                 };
00228                 /* finalization */
00229                 h1 ^= len; h2 ^= len; h3 ^= len; h4 ^= len;
00230 
00231                 h1 += h2; h1 += h3; h1 += h4;
00232                 h2 += h1; h3 += h1; h4 += h1;
00233 
00234                 h1 = fmix32(h1);
00235                 h2 = fmix32(h2);
00236                 h3 = fmix32(h3);
00237                 h4 = fmix32(h4);
00238 
00239                 h1 += h2; h1 += h3; h1 += h4;
00240                 h2 += h1; h3 += h1; h4 += h1;
00241 
00242                 ((uint32_t*)out)[0] = h1;
00243                 ((uint32_t*)out)[1] = h2;
00244                 ((uint32_t*)out)[2] = h3;
00245                 ((uint32_t*)out)[3] = h4;
00246 } /* MurmurHash3_x86_32(...) */

00249 /*!\fn void ht_node_destroy( void *node )
00250  *\brief destroy a HASH_NODE by first calling the HASH_NODE destructor
00251  *\param node The node to kill
00252  *\return NULL
00253  */
00254 void ht_node_destroy( void *node )
00255 {
00256                 HASH_NODE *node_ptr = (HASH_NODE *)node ;
00257                 __n_assert( node_ptr , return );
00258                 if( node_ptr -> type == HASH_STRING )
00259                 {
00260                                 Free( node_ptr  -> data . string );
00261                 }
00262                 if( node_ptr -> type == HASH_PTR )
00263                 {
00264                                 if( node_ptr -> destroy_func )
00265                                 {
00266                                                 node_ptr -> destroy_func( node_ptr  -> data . ptr );
00267                                 }
00268                                 /* No action if no free given 
00269                                    else
00270                                    {
00271                                    Free( node_ptr  -> data . ptr );
00272                                    }
00273                                    */
00274                 }
00275                 Free( node_ptr -> key );
00276                 Free( node_ptr )
00277 } /* ht_node_destroy */
00278

00281 /*!\fn char *ht_node_type( HASH_NODE *node )
00282  *\brief get the type of a node , text version
00283  *\param node node to check
00284  *\return NULL or the associated node type
00285  */
00286 char *ht_node_type( HASH_NODE *node )
00287 {
00288                 static char *HASH_TYPE_STR[ 5 ] = { "HASH_INT" , "HASH_DOUBLE" , "HASH_STRING" , "HASH_PTR" , "HASH_UNKNOWN" };
00289 
00290                 __n_assert( node , return NULL );
00291 
00292                 if( node -> type >= 0 && node -> type < HASH_UNKNOWN )
00293                                 return HASH_TYPE_STR[ node -> type ];
00294 
00295                 return NULL ;
00296 } /* ht_node_type(...) */

00299 
00300 /*!\fn HASH_TABLE *new_ht( int size )
00301  *\brief Create a hash table with the given size
00302  *\param size Size of the root hash node table
00303  *\return NULL or the new allocated hash table
00304  */
00305 HASH_TABLE *new_ht( int size )
00306 {
00307                 HASH_TABLE *table = NULL ;
00308 
00309                 if( size < 1 ) 
00310                 {
00311                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Invalide size %d for new_ht()" , size );
00312                                 return NULL ;
00313                 }
00314                 Malloc( table , HASH_TABLE , 1 );
00315                 __n_assert( table , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Error allocating HASH_TABLE *table" );return NULL );
00316 
00317                 table -> size = size ;
00318                 table -> nb_keys = 0 ;
00319                 table -> hash_table = (LIST **)calloc( size , sizeof( LIST *) );
00320                 __n_assert( table -> hash_table , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't allocate table -> hash_table !" );Free( table );return NULL );
00321 
00322                 for( int it = 0 ; it < size ; it ++ )
00323                 {
00324                                 table -> hash_table[ it ] = new_generic_list( 0 );  
00325                 }
00326                 return table ;
00327 } /* new_ht */
00328

00330 
00331 /*!\fn int ht_put_int( HASH_TABLE *table , char * key , int val )
00332  *\brief put an integral value with given key in the targeted hash table
00333  *\param table Targeted hash table
00334  *\param key Size Associated value's key
00335  *\param val integral value to put
00336  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00337  */
00338 int ht_put_int( HASH_TABLE *table , char * key , int val )
00339 {
00340                 uint32_t hash_value = 0 ;
00341                 unsigned int index = 0;
00342 
00343                 HASH_NODE *new_hash_node = NULL ;
00344                 HASH_NODE *node_ptr = NULL ;
00345 
00346                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00347                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00348 
00349                 MurmurHash3_x86_32( key , strlen( key ) , 42 , &hash_value );
00350                 index= (hash_value)%(table->size) ;
00351 
00352                 /* we have some nodes here. Let's check if the key already exists */
00353                 list_foreach( list_node , table -> hash_table[ index ] )
00354                 {
00355                                 node_ptr = (HASH_NODE *)list_node -> ptr ;
00356                                 /* if we found the same key we just replace the value and return */
00357                                 if( !strcmp( key , node_ptr -> key ) )
00358                                 {
00359                                                 /* let's check the key isn't already assigned with another data type */
00360                                                 if( node_ptr -> type == HASH_INT )
00361                                                 {
00362                                                                 node_ptr -> data . ival = val ;
00363                                                                 return TRUE ;
00364                                                 }
00365                                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't add key[\"%s\"] with type HASH_INT, key already exist with type %s" , node_ptr -> key , ht_node_type( node_ptr ) );
00366                                                 return FALSE ; /* key registered with another data type */   
00367                                 }
00368                 }
00369 
00370                 Malloc( new_hash_node , HASH_NODE , 1 );
00371                 __n_assert( new_hash_node , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Could not allocate new_hash_node" ); return FALSE );
00372 
00373                 new_hash_node -> key = strdup( key );
00374                 new_hash_node -> data. ival = val ;
00375                 new_hash_node -> type = HASH_INT ;
00376                 new_hash_node -> destroy_func = NULL ;
00377 
00378                 table -> nb_keys ++ ;
00379 
00380                 return list_push( table -> hash_table[ index ] , new_hash_node , &ht_node_destroy );     
00381 } /*ht_put_int() */
00382 
00383 
00384 
00385 /*!\fn int ht_put_double( HASH_TABLE *table , char * key , double val )
00386  *\brief put a double value with given key in the targeted hash table
00387  *\param table Targeted hash table
00388  *\param key Size Associated value's key
00389  *\param val double value to put
00390  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00391  */
00392 int ht_put_double( HASH_TABLE *table , char * key , double val )

00395                 unsigned int index = 0;
00396

00398                 HASH_NODE *node_ptr = NULL ;
00399 
00400                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00401                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00402 
00403                 MurmurHash3_x86_32( key , strlen( key ) , 42 , &hash_value );
00404                 index= (hash_value)%(table->size) ;
00405 
00406                 /* we have some nodes here. Let's check if the key already exists */
00407                 list_foreach( list_node , table -> hash_table[ index ] )
00408                 {
00409                                 node_ptr = (HASH_NODE *)list_node -> ptr ;
00410                                 /* if we found the same key we just replace the value and return */
00411                                 if( !strcmp( key , node_ptr -> key ) )
00412                                 {
00413                                                 /* let's check the key isn't already assigned with another data type */
00414                                                 if( node_ptr -> type == HASH_DOUBLE )
00415                                                 {
00416                                                                 node_ptr -> data . fval = val ;
00417                                                                 return TRUE ;
00418                                                 }

00421                                 }
00422                 }
00423

00426 
00427                 new_hash_node -> key = strdup( key );
00428                 new_hash_node -> data. fval = val ;
00429                 new_hash_node -> type = HASH_DOUBLE ;
00430                 new_hash_node -> destroy_func = NULL ;
00431 
00432                 table -> nb_keys ++ ;
00433 
00434                 return list_push( table -> hash_table[ index ] , new_hash_node , &ht_node_destroy );    
00435 } /*ht_put_double()*/

00439 /*!\fn int ht_put_ptr( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key , void  *val , void (*destructor)(void *ptr ) )
00440  *\brief put a pointer value with given key in the targeted hash table
00441  *\param table Targeted hash table
00442  *\param key Size Associated value's key
00443  *\param val pointer value to put
00444  *\param destructor Pointer to the ptr type destructor function. Leave to NULL if there isn't
00445  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00446  */
00447 int ht_put_ptr( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key , void  *val , void (*destructor)(void *ptr ) )
00448 { 
00449                 uint32_t hash_value = 0 ;
00450                 unsigned int index = 0;
00451 
00452                 HASH_NODE *new_hash_node = NULL ;
00453                 HASH_NODE *node_ptr = NULL ;
00454 
00455                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00456                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00457 
00458                 MurmurHash3_x86_32( key , strlen( key ) , 42 , &hash_value );
00459                 index= (hash_value)%(table->size) ;
00460 
00461                 /* we have some nodes here. Let's check if the key already exists */
00462                 list_foreach( list_node , table -> hash_table[ index ] )
00463                 {
00464                                 node_ptr = (HASH_NODE *)list_node -> ptr ;
00465                                 /* if we found the same key we just replace the value and return */
00466                                 if( !strcmp( key , node_ptr -> key ) )
00467                                 {
00468                                                 /* let's check the key isn't already assigned with another data type */
00469                                                 if( node_ptr -> type == HASH_PTR )
00470                                                 {
00471                                                                 if( list_node -> destroy_func )
00472                                                                 {
00473                                                                                 list_node -> destroy_func( node_ptr -> data . ptr );
00474                                                                                 node_ptr -> data . ptr = val ;
00475                                                                                 list_node -> destroy_func = destructor ;
00476                                                                 }
00477                                                                 return TRUE ;
00478                                                 }
00479                                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't add key[\"%s\"] with type HASH_PTR , key already exist with type %s" , node_ptr -> key , ht_node_type( node_ptr ) );
00480                                                 return FALSE ; /* key registered with another data type */   
00481                                 }
00482                 }
00483 
00484                 Malloc( new_hash_node , HASH_NODE , 1 );
00485                 __n_assert( new_hash_node , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Could not allocate new_hash_node" ); return FALSE );
00486 
00487                 new_hash_node -> key = strdup( key );
00488                 new_hash_node -> data . ptr = val ;
00489                 new_hash_node -> type = HASH_PTR ;
00490                 new_hash_node -> destroy_func = destructor ;
00491 
00492                 table -> nb_keys ++ ;
00493 
00494                 return list_push( table -> hash_table[ index ] , new_hash_node , &ht_node_destroy );   
00495 }/* ht_put_ptr() */

00499 /*!\fn int ht_put_string( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key , char  *val )
00500  *\brief put a null terminated char *string with given key in the targeted hash table
00501  *\param table Targeted hash table
00502  *\param key Associated value's key
00503  *\param val string value to put (will be strdup'ed)
00504  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00505  */
00506 int ht_put_string( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key , char  *val )
00507 {
00508                 uint32_t hash_value = 0 ;
00509                 unsigned int index = 0;
00510 
00511                 HASH_NODE *new_hash_node = NULL ;
00512                 HASH_NODE *node_ptr = NULL ;
00513 
00514                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00515                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00516 
00517                 MurmurHash3_x86_32( key , strlen( key ) , 42 , &hash_value );
00518                 index= (hash_value)%(table->size) ;
00519 
00520                 /* we have some nodes here. Let's check if the key already exists */
00521                 list_foreach( list_node , table -> hash_table[ index ] )
00522                 {
00523                                 node_ptr = (HASH_NODE *)list_node -> ptr ;
00524                                 /* if we found the same key we just replace the value and return */
00525                                 if( !strcmp( key , node_ptr -> key ) )
00526                                 {
00527                                                 /* let's check the key isn't already assigned with another data type */
00528                                                 if( node_ptr -> type == HASH_STRING )
00529                                                 {
00530                                                                 Free( node_ptr -> data . string );
00531                                                                 node_ptr -> data . string = strdup( val );
00532                                                                 return TRUE ;
00533                                                 }
00534                                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't add key[\"%s\"] with type HASH_STRING, key already exist with type %s" , node_ptr -> key , ht_node_type( node_ptr ) );
00535                                                 return FALSE ; /* key registered with another data type */   
00536                                 }
00537                 }
00538 
00539                 Malloc( new_hash_node , HASH_NODE , 1 );
00540                 __n_assert( new_hash_node , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Could not allocate new_hash_node" ); return FALSE );
00541 
00542                 new_hash_node -> key = strdup( key );
00543                 new_hash_node -> data . string = strdup( val );
00544                 new_hash_node -> type = HASH_STRING ;
00545                 new_hash_node -> destroy_func = NULL ;
00546 
00547                 table -> nb_keys ++ ;
00548 
00549                 return list_push( table -> hash_table[ index ] , new_hash_node , &ht_node_destroy );   
00550 } /*ht_put_string */

00554 /*!\fn HASH_NODE *ht_get_node( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key )
00555  *\brief return the associated key's node inside the hash_table
00556  *\param table Targeted hash table
00557  *\param key Associated value's key
00558  *\return The found node, or NULL
00559  */
00560 HASH_NODE *ht_get_node( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key )
00561 {
00562                 uint32_t hash_value = 0 ;
00563                 unsigned int index = 0;
00564 
00565                 HASH_NODE *node_ptr = NULL ;
00566 
00567                 __n_assert( table , return NULL );
00568                 __n_assert( key , return NULL );
00569 
00570                 MurmurHash3_x86_32( key , strlen( key ) , 42 , &hash_value );
00571                 index= (hash_value)%(table->size) ;
00572 
00573                 if( !table -> hash_table[ index ] -> start )
00574                 {
00575                                 return NULL ;
00576                 }
00577 
00578                 list_foreach( list_node , table -> hash_table[ index ] )
00579                 {
00580                                 node_ptr = (HASH_NODE *)list_node -> ptr ;
00581                                 if( !strcmp( key , node_ptr -> key ) )
00582                                 {
00583                                                 return node_ptr ;
00584                                 }
00585                 }
00586                 return NULL ;
00587 } /* ht_get_node() */
00588 
00589 
00590 
00591 /*!\fn int ht_get_int( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key , int *val )
00592  *\brief Retrieve an integral value in the hash table, at the given key. Leave val untouched if key is not found.
00593  *\param table Targeted hash table
00594  *\param key Size Associated value's key
00595  *\param val A pointer to a destination integer
00596  *\return TRUE or FALSE.
00597  */
00598 int ht_get_int( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key , int *val )
00599 {
00600                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00601                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00602 
00603                 HASH_NODE *node = ht_get_node( table , key );
00604 
00605                 if( !node ) return FALSE ;
00606 
00607                 if( node -> type != HASH_INT )
00608                 {
00609                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't get key[\"%s\"] of type HASH_INT, key is type %s" , key , ht_node_type( node ) );
00610                                 return FALSE ;
00611                 }
00612 
00613                 (*val) = node -> data . ival ;
00614 
00615                 return TRUE ;
00616 } /* ht_get_int() */
00617

00677  *\brief Retrieve a char *string value in the hash table, at the given key. Leave val untouched if key is not found.
00678  *\param table Targeted hash table
00679  *\param key Size Associated value's key
00680  *\param val A pointer to an empty destination char *string
00681  *\return TRUE or FALSE.
00682  */
00683 int ht_get_string( HASH_TABLE *table , char * key , char  **val )
00684 {
00685                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00686                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00687 
00688                 HASH_NODE *node = ht_get_node( table , key );
00689                 if( !node ) return FALSE ;
00690 
00691                 if( node -> type != HASH_STRING )
00692                 {
00693                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't get key[\"%s\"] of type HASH_STRING, key is type %s" , key , ht_node_type( node ) );
00694                                 return FALSE ;
00695                 }   
00696 
00697                 (*val) = node -> data . string ;
00698

00703 
00704 /*!\fn int ht_remove( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key )
00705  *\brief Remove a key from a hash table
00706  *\param table Targeted hash table
00707  *\param key Key to remove
00708  *\return TRUE or FALSE.
00709  */
00710 int ht_remove( HASH_TABLE *table , char *key )
00711 {
00712                 uint32_t hash_value = 0 ;
00713                 unsigned int index = 0;
00714 
00715                 HASH_NODE *node_ptr = NULL ;
00716                 LIST_NODE *node_to_kill = NULL ;
00717 
00718                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00719                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00720 
00721                 MurmurHash3_x86_32( key , strlen( key ) , 42 , &hash_value );
00722                 index= (hash_value)%(table->size) ;
00723 
00724                 if( !table -> hash_table[ index ] -> start )
00725                 {
00726                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't remove key[\"%s\"], table is empty" , key );
00727                                 return FALSE ;
00728                 }
00729 
00730                 list_foreach( list_node , table -> hash_table[ index ] )
00731                 {
00732                                 node_ptr = (HASH_NODE *)list_node -> ptr ;
00733                                 /* if we found the same */
00734                                 if( !strcmp( key , node_ptr -> key ) )
00735                                 {
00736                                                 node_to_kill = list_node ;   
00737                                                 break ;
00738                                 }
00739                 }
00740                 if( node_to_kill )
00741                 { 
00742                                 node_ptr = remove_list_node( table -> hash_table[ index ] , node_to_kill , HASH_NODE );
00743                                 ht_node_destroy( node_ptr );
00744 
00745                                 table -> nb_keys -- ;
00746 
00747                                 return TRUE ;
00748                 }
00749                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't delete key[\"%s\"]: inexisting key" , key );
00750                 return FALSE ;
00751 }/* ht_remove() */
00752 
00753 
00754 /*!\fn int empty_ht( HASH_TABLE *table )
00755  *\brief Empty a hash table
00756  *\param table Targeted hash table
00757  *\return TRUE or FALSE.
00758  */
00759 int empty_ht( HASH_TABLE *table )
00760 {
00761                 HASH_NODE *hash_node = NULL ;
00762 
00763                 __n_assert( table , return FALSE );
00764 
00765                 for( int index = 0 ; index < table -> size ; index ++ )
00766                 {
00767                                 while( table -> hash_table[ index ] -> start )
00768                                 {
00769                                                 hash_node = remove_list_node( table -> hash_table[ index ] , table -> hash_table[ index ] -> start , HASH_NODE );
00770                                                 ht_node_destroy( hash_node );
00771                                 }
00772                 }
00773                 table -> nb_keys = 0 ;
00774                 return TRUE ;
00775 } /* empty_ht */
00776 
00777 
00778 
00779 /*!\fn int destroy_ht( HASH_TABLE **table )
00780  *\brief Free and set the table to NULL  
00781  *\param table Targeted hash table
00782  *\return TRUE or FALSE.
00783  */
00784 int destroy_ht( HASH_TABLE **table )
00785 {
00786                 __n_assert( (*table) , n_log( LOG_ERR , "Can't destroy table: already NULL" ); return FALSE );
00787 
00788                 if( (*table )-> hash_table )
00789                 {
00790                                 empty_ht( (*table) );
00791 
00792                                 for( int it = 0 ; it < (*table) -> size ; it ++ )
00793                                 {
00794                                                 if( (*table) -> hash_table[ it ] )
00795                                                                 list_destroy( &(*table) -> hash_table[ it ] );
00796                                 }
00797                                 Free( (*table )->hash_table );
00798                 }
00799                 Free( (*table ) );
00800                 return TRUE ;
00801 } /* destroy_ht */
